page.title: 02WHERE WE LIVE IN DIPTFORD
page.content: The deep valleys in Diptford are mostly wooded. The river Avon snakes below the plateau on which Diptford stands.There are lots of{fields}in Diptford and lots of hedges.The fields arelike a patchwork quilt.Lots of land is undulating.At night time the{roads} look like silver ribbons.All the farms in Diptford are dotted around.Diptford is very sparsely populated.The buildings are varied. Some are built of the local {slate} and some houses and bungalows built of modern materials. The ancient Manors of Diptford and Crabadon are the oldest buildings. Some buildings date back to medaevil times and the original time of the Domesday Book. Diptford stands where Roman houses once stood.
